channel.title: The New Yorker — Reporting
channel.description: Latest reporting from The New Yorker

item.title: Patrick Radden Keefe on Truman Capote’s “In Cold Blood”
item.description: Capote’s journalistic transgressions were serious, but there is no denying the awesome influence of his work.

item.title: Denmark Is Sick of Being Bullied by Trump
item.description: The U.S., once Denmark’s closest ally, is threatening to steal Greenland and attacking the country’s wind-power industry. Is this a permanent breakup?

item.title: The Backcountry Rescue Squad at America’s Busiest National Park
item.description: In the Great Smoky Mountains, an auxiliary team of élite outdoorsmen answers the call when park-goers’ hikes, climbs, and rafting adventures go wrong.

item.title: How Marco Rubio Went from “Little Marco” to Trump’s Foreign-Policy Enabler
item.description: As Secretary of State, the President’s onetime foe now offers him lavish displays of public praise—and will execute his agenda in Venezuela and around the globe.

item.title: How WhatsApp Took Over the Global Conversation
item.description: The platform has become a core technology around the world, relied on by governments and extended families alike. What are we all doing there?

item.title: The Lights Are Still On in Venezuela
item.description: After the ouster of President Nicolás Maduro, some residents fear that one unelected despot has been swapped for another.

item.title: Vinson Cunningham on Barry Blitt’s Obama “Fist Bump” Cover
item.description: Here’s one big risk a public satirist of racism takes: by displaying tropes and crude imagery, he reveals just how well he knows and can deploy them himself.

item.title: Inside Bari Weiss’s Hostile Takeover of CBS News
item.description: The network’s new editor-in-chief has championed a press free from élite bias, while aligning herself with a billionaire class more willing than ever to indulge Donald Trump.

item.title: The Congresswoman Criminalized for Visiting ICE Detainees
item.description: LaMonica McIver went to tour an immigration jail in her New Jersey district. Now she faces seventeen years in prison.

item.title: The Ice Curtain
item.description: Since Putin invaded Ukraine, the short distance between Nome, Alaska, and Russia seems wider than ever.
